body_html: The main purpose of TensorOptions is to return a VariableType inside TensorOptions::type. How else can I create a Variable when calling an ATen function, without wrapping the function call in a variable construction? I.e. if all I have is at::ones(...) how can I create a Variable from within ATen? The only way I saw was this way. @colesbury
body_text: The main purpose of TensorOptions is to return a VariableType inside TensorOptions::type. How else can I create a Variable when calling an ATen function, without wrapping the function call in a variable construction? I.e. if all I have is at::ones(...) how can I create a Variable from within ATen? The only way I saw was this way. @colesbury
body: The main purpose of `TensorOptions` is to return a `VariableType` inside `TensorOptions::type`. How else can I create a `Variable` when calling an ATen function, without wrapping the function call in a variable construction? I.e. if all I have is `at::ones(...)` how can I create a `Variable` from within ATen? The only way I saw was this way. @colesbury
